speaker: Vale of Bones
line: Bone-white stones jut from the earth like the ribs of something too large to bury. An obelisk stands among them—smooth, black, and listening.

speaker: Obelisk Voice
line: Silence is the trial. Make no sound to claim the blade.

choices.text: Attempt the trial—slow breath, steady hands.
Speak anyway. Ask what the blade costs.
Kick a stone. Refuse the premise.

speaker: Obelisk Voice
line: The cost is not blood. It is restraint. Few can afford it.

speaker: Vale of Bones
line: For a heartbeat, the world becomes perfectly still—then returns with a shiver, as if disappointed you can still move.

speaker: Vale of Bones
line: A sharp sound rings out. Somewhere nearby, something answers it. Not a creature—an attention.

speaker: Obelisk Voice
line: Return when you can be quiet without feeling small.
